Reviews.Title: Best bang for your buck!
Reviews.Author: TP4217
Reviews.Content: I thought I made a mistake being that this LG LED TV would be primarily for sports viewing. I completely overlooked the 60hz refresh rate because I wanted so bad to get an LED TV and I thought I made a mistake by not getting at least a 120hz refresh rate for sports viewing. Well, I can honestly say with a straight face that I definitely did not make a mistake. No motion blur and I watch a lot of baseball and have been watching Wimbledon and neither the baseball or the tennis ball has any motion blur what so ever. I know the TV salespeople that push 120hz for sports fanatics will not be happy when I say that you do not need 120hz for sports viewing for this particular LED TV. I don't know about other 60hz LED TVS but this one does not have motion blur and you know how fast a baseball travels and tennis balls go pretty fast too. Now I read somewhere that anything 40 inches or smaller that you won't notice motion blur. That may be the reason why I am not noticing motion blur but it doesn't matter to me why I can watch quick moving sports on this TV without motion blur. I'm just thrilled that I didn't make a mistake and that viewing sports on this TV really is a great experience. This really is a bang for your dollar at 500 bucks.

Reviews.Title: Worth the price
Reviews.Author: G. Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Great buy for the price. The Picture Quality is great. The sensor bothered me at first but I just turned it off. If not the TV dims whenever someone turned off the lights. Everything else is ok and the TV fits perfectly in a 6 x 7 small room we had in the house. If you are looking for a small, lightweight TV for around $500, look no further. 5 starts!

Reviews.Title: LG 37" gaming greatness
Reviews.Author: Todd A. Coco "toddacoco"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV to connect to a new computer I just build as well as my PS3 and Xbox 360. All I can say so far is WOW!!. This LG tv is the real deal. I am running each through HDMI connections and am am very, very satisfied. I have run every game I love on this TV and have not regretted one single second. My set arrived within 2 days of ordering and it's setup took all of 15 minutes. I am sitting about 6 feet from it and is very very clear and crisp. Talk about the ultimate monitor. This one satisfies. Don't hesitate to get your hands on one of these at the great price Amazon has. Well it's back to more Red Dead Redemption. Whoa there, Let's Go!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Wow, what a fantastic television
Reviews.Author: T. Harward
Reviews.Content: I am pleasantly surprised by this LCD/LED TV. It has the fantastic and unexpected characteristic of not being in any way annoying or unpleasant.Let me explain.For some reason, nearly 100% of the flat panel televisions I've owned over the last 3 years have been in some way annoying or just a pain to use. The first was a Sharp 32", and it was okay except for being slow at channel and input switching, which got on my nerves after a while. It also had a weird auto-dimming feature that you *could not shut off.* Dumb. The second, a Sharp 37" was simply bigger, but shared most of the problems and annoyances, but I had already learned to deal with them. Finally, a huge upgrade to a Samsung 46" ultra-flat wall mount LED-backlit panel that we thought would be perfect and the godsend of TV's--turns out, no, it's also annoying. The input switch dialog doesn't go away after selecting inputs, meaning that you *must* keep the samsung remote around so you can press the OK button. Also, the panel itself was slow! Impossible to use as a monitor since the mouse took about a second to catch up with your movements, and it had too high a lag for gaming (but was better in "Game" mode) Anyway, I digress...This TV has no annoyances I can find yet. Honestly, nothing is wrong with it. Every turn of the corner, every new feature, every time I go to use it I'm simply *delighted* at how nice it is to use and operate, as well as how great the picture is, and how there's literally zero delay or lag in the picture. Absolutely fantastic on all counts. My favorite part is how fast the menus and input switching are, and how intuitive they are to use. The input selector has clear large icons showing all inputs and which ones are connected, and goes away cleanly after selecting one without further interaction, meaning I can use my universal remote and stash the LG one! Beautiful. The gaming performance is also top notch, and it even works great as a monitor with clean clear text and good contrast (plus it saves picture settings per-input so you can set up your PC with lower sharpness and matched color!)I'm even impressed by the little technical things: for example, it has an Optical audio TOSLiNK output port--and it redirects the HDMI digital audio to it! This is fantastic since it allows me to use HDMI audio and still get the digital audio to my older receiver (which doesn't have HDMI support) while using the TV to switch sources. This actually saves me 3 digital audio cables and opens up 3 Toslink ports on my receiver--incredibly useful, and even the top-of-the-line Samsung behemoth would not do this.A couple other notes: don't be fooled by marketing gimmicks that are plentiful in this day and age. 3D? Don't bother. 120Hz? Doesn't make a bit of difference. "Tru Motion" or "Motion Smoothing"? It will make you sick, trust me. This TV has none of those, and good riddance. It's so nice to see a TV which is simply solidly built with a focus on the useful features.Overall this is just an impeccably designed TV with the right balance of features, picture quality, and most importantly, solid User Interaction design. I'm so impressed with this TV that If LG keeps this up then they'll never lose me as a customer. And at this cheap a price, this is honestly the best value TV on the market at this size and resolution. Don't hesitate.*UPDATE* 1/26/2012 - Well, I had my 37" LG 3500 for about 4 months, and then it was unfortunately stolen (yep, break in and robbery, no kidding--always use your deadbolt). So I went for the same model, but in the 42" size since I loved it so much. Needless to say I am still completely satisfied, the 42" model is every bit as good as the 37, with no noticeable difference in refresh or game lag or picture quality. This seems to be a very good panel. Picture is superb at 42" and it makes 1080p even more worth it, Blu-Rays and DVD's alike look great.One thing I noticed as I got the TV set up for the first time is all the normal stuff I do whenever I get a new TV--but I thought I'd document it. First, turn off the "Power Save" mode, it just dims the screen during dark parts and doesn't do it perfectly, so it does get annoying. The panel is very low-power to begin with due to the LED backlight, so there's not much to worry about. Fortunately easy to turn off. Second, anything with a techie-sounding marketing name in the menu? Yeah, shut it off. "Real Cinema": off. etc. I increased the backlight just slightly since my TV is in a fairly well-lit room, but you may not need to. Contrast, brightness, color, sharpness, all have wonderful defaults and don't need changing. TV looks great after those adjustments.Still very impressed, very happy, and glad for the upgrade even though the robbery was very unfortunate.

Reviews.Title: Gaming glory
Reviews.Author: Timothy Bennett "Electronics dreamer t.j."
Reviews.Content: I chose this tv because after a lot of research i knew i didn't want a 120hz tv because i hate the way it makes the picture look.  Like a soap opera.  Good movies feel like you're watching the movie being made instead of a cinematic experience.  So i knew i wanted a 60hz tv because 120 is a joke and marketing scam.  Read any avs forum.So what makes a good picture.  The response time.  That is the amount of time it takes a black to turn to a white.  The largest color change in the spectrum.  The longer this process takes, the more blur.  Blur is B A D.  Plasma's have such a good picture quality because the response time is .001ms.  Most LED tv's are 8 to 5 ms.  This tv is 4ms.  This is also very crucial for gaming because it can actually make your eyes hurt after a while and the blur will also make you think you saw something that you didn't actually see.  4ms is very fast for a 60hz tv and especially on a bigger tv.  Some computer gaming monitors reach down to 1 or 2 ms but most 5ms. I've gone with the gaming monitors before and only brands like Samsung and Lg do a good job of making a good picture.One last thing about the picture.  This tv does have some edge bleeding.  It's not that bad but it's there. I've seen a lot worse.  In fact it is minimal on this tv so i was happy.  You only notice it when the screen is black though.As for looks.  My friends comment on how thin it is everytime.All in all i am very happy with the picture quality, the looks of the tv itself and one thing that i forgot to mention is that this tv does an awesome job at reducing glare.  My plasma is horrible lol.

Reviews.Title: Great Television
Reviews.Author: Greg M. Robinson
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my new LG 42LV3500 1080p LED TV, out of the box thus unit was turn key, this unit is replacing my LG 37 in LCD television, my 37 inch was working perfectly but decided to up grade to full HD and the LED model, I have to say the picture color and clarity is stunning to me, minor adjustments were to make the auto picture dimming set to medium, and the usual detailing of the picture but I have all my components linked up via HDMI and I am really impressed, one feature I like is the live scan, with this turned on you can operate the television or the blue ray and the TV knows how and what to change to and back to automatically, pretty cool feature In my estimation you can not go wrong with LG its kind of a thing of either you like there products or not, I have several appliances that are LG and have never had an issue with anything, I am expecting many years of fine television viewing.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Cat5Dookie "Cat5Dookie"
Reviews.Content: I bought a LCD Sharp 37 inch about 4 years ago and compare that to this TV.  Boy does this TV put it to shame.  Not in terms of picture quality but about everything else.  It's sharp(no pun intended) looking with piano black frame, light(cant be more than 30 lbs), LCD(uses less electricity), 2 HDMI ports, and is very slim.  For 560.00 this cant be beat.  Annoying feature I dont like is the power-save dim mode.  But no prob, you can turn it off.  Very Happy.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture, excellent value
Reviews.Author: jray
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace my 37 inch Samsung LCD. The picture on this LG set is even better. My expectations were not high as I thought for the price of this being so reasonable for an LED set there would be something I didn't like but boy is the picture on this set sweet. I have a high end Sony LED set and the picture on the LG LED set is just as nice.It has a fairly thin bezel and its foot print is not too much larger than the 37" Samsung I bought a year and a half ago. The styling is very clean and looks nice although the bezel is on the shiny side but thats the case with most sets these days. The menus are very easy to navigate. As for the sound its pretty good given the constraints of the thinness of the panel. I think the Cinema sound mode sounds best.I did need to fiddle for about 20 minutes with the picture settings to get things right but once done this picture really pops (the out of the box settings are not great). While this is a 60Hz set I don't notice any motion blur watching sports (motion blur really is not an issue with the modern quality displays anyway) so not going with 120Hz set will save you a few dollars. Overall this set is great value for a very nice set.I would purchase this set again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Beautiful LED HDTV!!!
Reviews.Author: G..W.BUSH
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful, clear picture, and very thin panel(this was the reason that I bought this TV).  I saw many review about the LG is using both IPS and Non-IPS panel, and stated something about outside the box 3500UA-CUSDxx, then this unit is a IPS panel? If someone can clarify where did you obtain this information? I can not find anything online about this?  My unit is 3500UA-CULVLH, so what is that make my unit?  Other than that, this is a very nice TV, I was hesitate to get this TV, but glad that I bought it.  Very close to SAMSUNG (I still think SAMSUNG has the best TV on the market right now), but this TV is much better than SONY in regarding to picture and sound. This LG has a feature call PICTURE WIZARD, which will walk you step by step to show you how to calibrate your picture, I thought that was very nice.  You can be able to view it at a different angels without worry about the clarity of the picture. The price on Amazon is very good, beside they will match price if you see somewhere has lower price.  I did get a price adjustment for $60.00 after I bought it.  Customer services at Amazon was very quick to verify and make the adjustment when I make the call.

Reviews.Title: Really surprised : )
Reviews.Author: E. White
Reviews.Content: Received the LG LED 37LV3500 one day ago. The box was slightly damaged but thankfully the TV wasn't. I picked LG because my dad owns an LG 52 inch which looks stunning so I decided to give LG a shot and Im glad I did. This TV is now replacing my 32 inch Vizio. This TV puts Vizio to shame, the detail and crystal clear picture are miles ahead of Vizio. The settings and features are great too. The audio is actually decent for an LED, although I use a 7.1 receiver I hardly use the TV audio. I highly recommend this TV especially if you own a Blu-Ray player or Xbox 360. I was noticing detail on my Blu-Rays that I had never seen before until I purchased this TV. If your looking to convert from standard def into high def then please don't take the easy way out and purchase a cheap brand like Vizio I made that mistake. Save your money and put it towards an LG or Samsung, it may be more expensive but you will get a top notch product.

Reviews.Title: great picture and sound
Reviews.Author: hector1021
Reviews.Content: I have to said that was what i was expecting a great picture quality but in order to get this i have to calibrate my tv in the picture menu this are my options backlight 90,brightness 70,contrast 95, sharpness 70, color 70, black level low, dynamic contrast off, dynamic color high, gamma medium, temperature cool, after doing this the picture came out to life, great audio too, one of the best tv's i ever had really recommended. It has three hdmi, two component and two composite what more can you ask.

Reviews.Title: A few corners cut, but i'll take it
Reviews.Author: DGK
Reviews.Content: Well, I un-boxed it and went straight for the review. Set up was a breeze. Display controls are limited and remote is a little cheap. This model directly challenges the Samsung UN40C5000. In that they are both entry level LED Television sets, clocked at 60Hz refresh rate. Although the LG 42LV3500 provides a higher contrast 10,000,000:1 ratio. One thing I did notice was less light edge bleeding on the sides compared to the Samsung. Also, navigating from the HDD external was slightly easier. Fully compatible with Mkv files and other HD extensions. SO if I had to choose I'd go with the LG. Take a look-[...]. You can also look up "oceansidecreations" on youtube, to see the review.

Reviews.Title: Superb picture quality, but bad internal speakers
Reviews.Author: P. Hillman
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my bedroom, so I was looking for a 42" TV for wall mounting.  I could not go larger than 42" for the wall location, and I didn't want to go smaller.  I did not want a Vizio TV from Costco, because the models they had contained features I did not need, and they were not very good looking.  I could care less about 3D and built-in Wi-Fi, and I learned that 120Hz refresh rates ruined the look of most broadcasts and movies (soft "soap opera" look with 120Hz).  After reading reviews here, I also learned that the LG TVs smaller than 55" don't have the ability to turn off the 120Hz feature.  So the LG 42LV3500 was perfect for my needs.  The LED backlighting provides "instant-on" viewing without any warm-up times with conventional LCD TVs.  The TV is also thinner and lighter than conventional LCD TVs.  The thinness is also its downfall.  With a TV that is only about 1 inch thick, there is no room for quality speakers.  You can only do so much with 1 inch depth.  The stereo speakers are at the bottom of the set, which is slightly thicker than the rest of the TV, to accommodate the speakers.  However, they are still very small speakers that distort quite easily, even with vocal dialog.  Since it is a TV for the bedroom, I wasn't expecting movie theater quality, but the built-in speakers should at least handle vocal dialog without distortion.  Thankfully, I have a two-channel digital receiver with speakers directly below the TV, so now all audio goes through the receiver, and the built-in speakers are turned off.  So it is highly recommended to use an external audio source with this TV.  I would imagine that every LED TV that is 1 inch thick has lousy built-in speakers.  They are all limited by design.  The other downside to this TV is that the power cord is hard-wired to the TV, which can make wall mounting difficult.  It is far easier to route the power cable through the wall without requiring the TV to be on the wall.  That is not an option with this TV.  I was able to get the job done, but it just took longer.  Now the TV cannot be removed from the wall unless I also pull the power cord out of the wall to do so.  That was a bad design choice by LG.  Would have been far easier to have the power cord plug into the back of the TV.  The picture quality is superb for anything you throw at it.  Broadcast 1080i, 720p, and 480p images look excellent, and 1080p Blu-Ray looks amazing as always.  I love the look of the TV too, just a simple no-frills black border.  The 3 HDMIs meet my needs with my TiVo HD, Blu-Ray, and AppleTV2.  I even have a VHS deck plugged into the standard AV in, through the receiver.  You can use the side HDMI and still hide the HDMI cable so it is not visible.  If you need more than three HDMIs, you should consider a stereo receiver with HDMI to handle the video switching.  Since this is a bedroom TV, I can get by with the built-in HDMIs.  I use a Logitech Harmony remote to control all the components.  The LG remote is quite nice for a TV without all the fancy features.  The best part is that I got this TV in "Like New" condition from the Amazon Warehouse for $476 (The new price at the time was $529).  It was a customer returned item.  It still had the factory packaging on the TV.  So for the amazing deal that I got on this TV, it is a fantastic TV.  Just use an external audio source, and you will have a great set up.

Reviews.Title: very good  product !
Reviews.Author: mebarack
Reviews.Content: is a great tv for the price , i guess you could not find anything better in the market for the price considering that is a LED!!!

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: asdf
Reviews.Content: I've been using this tv for about a year now with PS3 and xbox only. I've used calibration discs to set them up in low light rooms and I ended up turning the backlighting all the way to zero and I turn off all of the trumotion cinemotion, active sharpening nonsense off.If you don't turn that stuff off it makes movies look like reality tv, and it makes hard edges in games look really terrible.anyway, I couldn't be happier. it seem reliable. it has a bunch of hdmi inputs

Reviews.Title: Awesome value for your money
Reviews.Author: volodoscope "Artist by heart, geek by nature"
Reviews.Content: Nothing comes close to LED TV's slim size. I love how light this TV is. My old LCD was close to 45lbs and this thing is half that.PROS:--3 HDMI connections--sharp--nice picture quality controls--looks great playing XBox or watching ESPN--customizable--nice "Voice" feature where speaking voices are crisp and slightly louder--light weight--solid--energy efficient ($13 a year on power consumption, that's crazy)--very affordable higher quality TVCONS:--because how thin the TV is some HDMI cables stick out and hit the wall (I got 90degree angle HDMI connector for $3 to solve this problem)--speakers are not as bad as some other cheaper TVs, but still little low and hollow--Styrofoam packaging (c'mon LG!)

Reviews.Title: Superb picture at a great price
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: This is the third flatscreen TV I've bought in the past three years (the others were a 50" Pioneer Kuro plasma and a 42" Panasonic P42ST30). The Pioneer has an absolutely beautiful picture, but is no longer made and being a plasma generates a ton of heat in the room. This LG has nearly the same picture quality, is decently priced and was simple to setup. It's also very energy efficient and quite slim.I've noticed I'm very sensitive to motion blur common on LED/LCD TVs and unfortunately I also really don't like how most set's motion smoothing makes TV look. This LG is the first LED/LCD I've found that has the same smooth TV like motion that my plasma has. Perhaps the small size makes it less noticeable or perhaps LG really does do something better than the other LED/LCD sets.Besides the great looking motion handling, color and brightness are superb as well.Like every modern TV, the remote is incomprehensible beyond the channel, volume and power buttons.

Reviews.Title: The Real Deal
Reviews.Author: Prewitt Owen
Reviews.Content: This was my first time purchasing an item this expensive and fragile online so I was a bit nervous but decided to bite the bullet, after all these tvs didn't just magically appear in the box stores. They had to be trucked there so...I could not be more pleased with the tv and transaction. It had free shipping, a great price, excellent reviews and was exactly the size I needed. There are lots of 32", 40" and larger but not many 37" LED models available and I can tell ya these reviews were spot on. This is one terrific value, superb picture on HD DTV receiver with no noticible motion blur even on NFL games. The sound is not the best I've heard but not the worst either. The tv was scheduled to arrive on the 21st but Amazon emailed that they were shipping it early at no expense and it arrived in perfect condition on the 14th !Note: as with any of these HDTVs, there is some tweaking needed at set-up. There is a review here that lays out a detailed setting for this tv that I found very helpful. I used it as my base and then tweaked a little more for my personal preferences so a big thank you to that reviewer for the very helpful post.

Reviews.Title: LG 42 LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: VinceL
Reviews.Content: Easy controlsFast setupGreat picture qualityfair sound from built-in speakersFast deliveryWhat more could you ask for at this price?  I would recommend this TV to anyone looking for a good quality HDTV at a great price

Reviews.Title: STUNNING
Reviews.Author: bones "bones"
Reviews.Content: My short recommendation:If you are planning to go for eitherLG 42LK450 42-Inch 1080p 60Hz LCD HDTV http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004OOQ8CW/ref=oh_o05_s00_i00_detailsorLG 42LV3500 42-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LED-LCD HDTV http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004OVEVOM/ref=oh_o02_s00_i00_detailsand BlueRigger High Speed HDMI Cable with Ethernet 6.6 Feet (2m) - Supports 3D and Audio Return [Latest Version] http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00316263Y/ref=oh_o00_s00_i00_detailsJust go for these provided you are willing to go through some POSSIBLE TV return/exchange hassle (I could have just been the unforunate one but Amazon has ensured SO FAR I never felt that way - but I plan to update this review if they don't continue giving me the same comfort feeling with this TV buying experience episode)Details:LED LCD [LG 42LV3500] vs regular LCD [LG 42LK450]I had an opportunity to look at both these TVs and I should say, the picture quality is nothing less than STUNNING for both of them.There is a reason for the high number of positive reviews and I think it is the stunning picture quality that doesn't stop WOW-ing. While I like the natural color quality in the regular LCD, my wife liked the crispness of LED-LCD picture and also the thickness of the LED LCD TV was way smaller than the regular LCD TV. While personally I liked the regular LCD better (you get a more natural TV like color feel), my wife liked the LED-LCD (you get a more Computer Monitor like feel). Another thing to note, LG 42LV3500 I received has a matte finish (but don't expect the matte level of computer monitors, there is still some glossiness on LG 42LV3500, but it sure seems like a Matte finish screen. It could even be an IPS panel but I don't know that for sure). LG 42LK450 I received has a glossy finish. Some people might like glossy monitors as opposed to matte and possibly because of the same reason I felt the regular LCD had more natural looking colors.I used the following 1080p video on Youtube to test the TV picture quality and sound quality as well. I got this link when I googled for 1080p songs. This is a song apparently from Indian cinema with A.R. Rehman's music with bright colors in the song. Make sure you change the 360p on the right bottom of the video to 1080p HD before playing the video. Just search for "ROBO HD VIDEO SONG Endhiran Bluray 1080p x264 DTS 5 1 Raj1402" in youtube and click on the first link.[...]I used the bluerigger HDMI cable running from my computer to the TV. You can see how this song and it's bright colors fill the screen, it is simply stunning on the TV.Sound qualityIf you want to avoid going through manual audio quality set up, just choose Cinema sound mode (You don't need need to necessarily choose Cinema picture along with Cinema sound, you can choose Cinema sound quality and leave the default/off picture mode) and the cinema mode sound is pretty loud enough for me.Refresh quality [60hz]:Honestly I am yet to notice what people seemed to talk about a lot. I think choosing a HDTV can be a hit or miss depending on the model. So just because a model has 120hz doesn't mean you are gaining something. You might end up losing on the picture quality if that model turns out bad. Same with looking for a SMART wifi TV and taking a gamble on possibly losing out picture quality. I can tell you from my own experience, both LG 42LV3500 and LG 42LK450 have stunning picture quality.If you are going to be watching sports all the time, this may or may not be the right model for you, but I can't really speak for it because i don't watch much sports and i haven't notice any difference on fast moving movie scenes. If you keep looking for a difference, you may notice something that might not even be closely related to the 60hz refresh rate but you might think, "oh, this might not happen if it was 120hz". Bottom line, if you are very particular about it, go to Best buy or your friend's place with some fast moving sports video and request them to check your video out on both 60 & 120hz TVs and see if you notice any difference and whether that difference makes any difference to you.Now coming to the POSSIBLE TV return/exchange hassle (I could have just been the unforunate one but Amazon has ensured SO FAR I never felt that way - but I plan to update this review if they don't continue giving me the same comfort feeling with this TV buying experience episode)My first LG 42LK450 arrived with a gaping hole on the center of the box [I guess it happened during shipping]. I REFUSED the delivery. So no real hassle there for me. Courier person offered that I open and find out if there any damage. If I had done that I suppose it would equal to accepting the shipment and then I would have gone through the return process. Anyways, I simply refused the courier person's offer and delivery. Amazon sent me a replacement immediately. The replacement arrived in good shape but when I kept using it, it was emitting a strong plastic smell from behind the TV whenever the TV was on. Amazon was very sorry, created an RMA and it went back to Amazon as well.My first LG 42LV3500 arrived in good shape [i mean the outside box] but had a dent behind the TV that was causing light bleed right at the place of the dent. Amazon once again was very sorry and this was replaced immediately.

Reviews.Title: Glad I chose it!
Reviews.Author: grefgirl16
Reviews.Content: I actually got my TV about a month ago but to me writing a review two days after you get it doesn't do anyone any good. I don't have cable so sadly I can't give an opinion on how cable looks but I can tell you that Netflix works awesome! All of my movies look great and the picture is crystal clear!The set up was really easy and it takes you through step by step.The sound quality is great! I have a family with a two and four year old living above me and I can still hear everything great!The stand is a little wobbly but it has not fallen over yet (knock on wood).It tells you which inputs are plugged in which is nice so I am not just flicking through the inputs looking for the right thing.All in all I would definitely recommend this TV. It is a nice size and the quality has been awesome so far. If anything goes wrong I will be sure to write about it on here.

Reviews.Title: Life is good with this LG TV so far
Reviews.Author: scutpuppy
Reviews.Content: I got this TV for about 1 wk now and am very happy with it. Pictures are very crisp and clear without any blurring problem with watching the NCAA tournament games all week. The sound is very adequate for watching TV despite other people's complaint about it. This TV has a refresh rate of either 2.4 or 4 msec so it is pretty fast. You really do not need the 120 Hz speed. Watching HDTV programs or Bluray movies with this TV is pretty amazing in terms of picture. However, I like 1080p plasma picture a little better. I have an LG bluray player and this TV communicate with it automatically, which is cool. I also have it hooked up to an LG bookshelf speaker system via the TV optical output and it works great. As for people who complain that it does not have an RCA analog audio output to connect to outside speakers, you should be able to connect a computer speaker set with or without subwoofer via its headphone output. It also comes with an adapter cable to convert the 3mm computer audio input or headphone output to RCA analog audio connections. I assume that people want to be able to connect better speakers to watch movies or sports on TV so they do not have to turn on their receivers every time. I just happen to put my TV in the kitchen where we watch TV the most so I do not have room for a bulky receiver and a surround speaker set. As far as providing sharp pictures, this TV delivers big time. The screen is somewhat glossy but it is not as glossy as the Samsung's unit. I prefer the glossy screen because it gives clear pictures with more vibrant colors IMO. I noticed that when I watch a standard definition program, I can see some blurring effect so I think the cause is not the TV but rather the programming source itself.

Reviews.Title: Best TV ever!!
Reviews.Author: Will.White78
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for almost 3 months now. So far it has exceeded everything I have ever expected from a TV. I had a Sony Bravio 40" before this that shorted out. This TV has a better picture, better look, and better build than any other TV i have looked at!! The colors are amazing and for being so thin the sound is not bad at all! I searched for about a month for a new TV and am very re-leaved to have picked this one. If the price listed here on Amazon is the lowest, do not hesitate to buy this TV! I was hesitant to make a purchase like this over the internet, but I paid the $3.99 for next day shipping, received it the next day and had it hooked up in minutes! Came safe and sound, delivered to my door step by UPS. For the gamers out there, I own a PS3 hooked up to this bad boy with HDMI and have never seen anything better! All around good TV worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: Very nice - quite pleased!
Reviews.Author: Rufus Juskus
Reviews.Content: I bought this off of Amazon and have had it for a week.The picture was not that great right out of the box, and I discovered the "Picture Wizard" as one of the features and after running through that, the picture came alive. I'm quite pleased with the result.I'm running the sound through a sound system, so sound is great - can't comment on the tv's onboard speakers.Features I like: it has a matte finish screen so there's no glare. Also, the stand allows the tv to swivel left and right, which comes in handy.All in all, I'm loving this tv - never had an LG before. This replaces a Visio Razor 37 inch which died after 29 days - luckily, Amazon allowed me to return it and I decided to go with LG - so far, so good.So the price is good, the quality seems excellent, and Amazon's customer service is great - very nice experience all around.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture and Features
Reviews.Author: Ronden
Reviews.Content: My husband did all the research in getting our t.v.  and I am very pleased with this one.  The pictures looks great.  I love the HDMI feature.  We also got an LG Blu-Ray player and the tv works seamlessly with the player.  The remotes are interchangeable.  I have had no problems with the tv and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: K. smart
Reviews.Content: I don't know a whole lot about TV's but I love this one!  The only downside would be the controls on the actual tv are sometimes a little tricky to find the right spot to "press" them since they're sensors.  Otherwise, LOVE it.

Reviews.Title: Buzzing Sound, But Great Service from Amazon.com
Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: The TV looked great and had a clear, crisp picture.  The size was perfect for our bedroom.  However, after a few days I noticed a buzzing sound coming from the front right speaker.  I emailed the Returns Department at amazon.com, and they were wonderful!  They replied within two hours with arrangements for UPS to pick up the TV the next day and return it.  I was refunded the full purchase price within three days.  Although the TV was a disappointment, I can't say enough good things about amazon.com's customer service.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture!
Reviews.Author: Kurses
Reviews.Content: Love this TV! I have a smaller 32in LG and I knew it was a good brand. I am very happy with the picture and the sound, the TV is great and super thin. The only reason I didn't give all the stars is because as I have been reading other reviews I noticed that I over paid, apparently this TV was offered for 450-500. If I were you I'd wait to purchase it for less, but I'm not that disappointed considering it was well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: LG TV replaces the old, but....
Reviews.Author: lscot "lscot"
Reviews.Content: My sturdy Phillips Ambi-Light flat-screen TV was one of the first of the larger (32") flat-screen TV's, which I purchased in 2000 as a factory refurbished and deeply discounted item. It was on pretty much all day for all these years and served me well. But the monitor finally gave out a few months ago. After some research I replaced it with the LG 37" LED-LCD flat screen TV, a size that just fits in my TV cabinet. Comp[ared to the Phillips this TV is one quarter the weight and and equally slim, so it was very easy to handle. The biggest problem I had was attaching the stand, which on my own took more than an hour; it was a cumbersome process for two parts. The TV comes with a sophisticated built-in set of adjustments so you can get the picture that is best suited to the room and lighting. It also has a feature where the image adjusts itself as lighting conditions change. All of this was fine. However, I was expecting to be wowed by a new state of the art image, and I have to admit I was disappointed. It improved as I fiddled with the settings, but ultimately, compared to the grand-daddy Phillips, I was surprised to find the image lacking in a certain depth of color and saturation compared to the Phillips. I liken it to the difference between a high quality photo image taken with film and the same image taken with a digital camera. It's just missing something and I was expecting it to have added something more. The picture is sharper and the colors brighter, but something is just off. For instance, I am very aware that news broadcasters are obviously wearing make-up for the camera. Also, in the past I was able to used my Bose Speakers via my DVD player/receiver along with the TV speakers. With this TV, that arrangement produces an echo, so I have to chose one or the other; so I use the good speakers with music shows and the TV speakers for regular viewing; this also was a disappointment. That said, now that I have had it for a while, it is a perfectly fine superior piece of technology and I am happy with it. While I might have gotten an image a little closer to expectation by visiting retail stores, there is something to be said for having the TV delivered to your doorstep in a box, trouble-free of having to transport it across a parking lot and across town. All in all I am happy with this purchase, but I would recommend some comparison shopping first, not that I am convinced that would have made a difference. I have found shopping with Amazon Prime to be worth the investment for product quality, piece of mind and convenience.

Reviews.Title: BEST FITS OUR NEEDS - MOVIE DOES NOT LOOK LIKE SOAP OPERA !!!!
Reviews.Author: Kamala
Reviews.Content: I am sure when folks look at the 60 HZ frequency, they feel the TV is outdated. I went to all my friends place who had the latest configuration for frequency (120 Hz, 240 Hz)and noted that all movies looked like soap operas. When i wanted to buy a TV i was breaking my head as to what TV to buy1. which fits my budget (around $600)2. which is an LED TV (less energy consumption)3. in which movies does not look like a soap operaThis was my perfect match. it was $590 when i got it on a thanksgiving deal. This does not have internet/ netflix on TV. however, i have a sony BLuray player that can be connected wireless with TV and has a capability of browsing internet thru TV. This is a LED TV. This is a 60 Hz frequency (though seems outdated) is perfect for watching movies like moviees. I confess i am not a great sports fan. The 120 Hz television is for sports buffs and National Geographic TV which provides more resolution when watching these type of channels.BEST FITS OUR NEEDS !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Happy with this TV so far
Reviews.Author: S. D. Bartlett "stevedbmw"
Reviews.Content: I am quite pleased with my new LG 37LV3500 1080p LED TV, out of the box thus unit was almost turn-key. Replaced a 37" Sony projection TV (whose projection tube died in 4yr+2mon, 2 months after extended contract expired) which did not have anywhere near the picture quality as this set.  Had to fiddle with it a bit, which wasn't difficult, to get the right balance, and it looks great except some difficulty when scenes are very dark, but then this might be characteristic of the breed.  Sound is awful without an external amp; my solution was to take sound off the cable box analog to my preexisting Bose Wave unit, which works great but has to be controlled independently thru the universal remote.Best features: Bright sharp picture image for most scenes; light weight; easy set up; wide viewing range horiz & vert.Worst features (like all flat panel, wall mountable) lousy speakersUntested: Reliability and serviceability.  This is our first LG TV and hope it was not a mistake.Although bought from Amazon @ $630, don't consider it an exceptional bargain, but compared to other 37" LED brands, and comparing reviews, this one looked the best.

Reviews.Title: WORTH IT!
Reviews.Author: Roberto C Tirado
Reviews.Content: I bought the 42" set to watch the Superbowl with a Mohu HDTV antenna and the picture was Awesome!  There was NO motion blur problems with the 60 HZ refresh rate. I was able to fully appreciate the beautiful high definition picture of this 1080p set. I tried a comparison in picture quality by unhooking the Mohu antenna and reconnecting my regular cable feed and the picture was HORRIBLE and DIM! I switched back to the Mohu and was able to see individual hairs on people's heads, I could count the spots and freckles on Brady's face - It was like watching the game thru a window!  hahahaha.  I LOVE THIS FREAKIN TV!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV but watch out for the power saving
Reviews.Author: John C.
Reviews.Content: When we first turned on this TV we wondered why it was so dark.  At night in a dark room it was hard to see the picture.  We turned off the power saving features and POW what a difference.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Mike In Kennesaw
Reviews.Content: I bought his TV as a Christmas gift for a friend. It is amazingly beautiful!! 60 Hz -vs- 120 Hz refresh rate on a 37" TV does not seem to be an issue. Easy to set up and great picture out of the box. My son set everything up and we were watching amazing video in no time! My son hooked his Apple Mac laptop to the TV and the video was amazing! I would recommend this TV to anyone who has a limited space constraint with a desire for a great TV viewing experience! I also have a 47" LG LED/LCD TV with a 240 Hz refresh rate. Of course I like mine better, especially when played through my Klipsch driven surround sound, but this 37" is pretty darned awesome too!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful clarity for sports and movies
Reviews.Author: J_Sant "books4less"
Reviews.Content: Was deciding between the LG 42LV4400 (http://www.amazon.com/LG-42LV4400-42-Inch-1080p-LED-LCD/dp/B005JK01GO/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid;=1325916496&sr;=8-1) and this TV (LG 42LV3500).  Both were 42 inch LED, which I wanted, but the only difference I could see was that the LG 42LV4400 had 120 hz and this one had 60 hz.  Also, the 42LV4400 had a 10,000 contrast ratio, while this one had 3 million.  However, research suggests TV manufactures really stretch the truth about contrast ratios, so take them with a "grain of salt."Well, I decided to choose this one because I heard the 120 hz was unnecessary for sports (its broadcast in 60hz anyway), and because some reviewers said the 42LV4400 TVs seemed to stop working after a while.So glad I chose this model!  You DO NOT need 120 hz.  I watch football and basketball and there was absolutely no video lag whatsoever. Sports and movies looked fantastic.Pros:- USB input on the TV plays music, photos, and VIDEOS.  Many other TVs can only display pictures via the USB drive.- Power, channel, and volume buttons are on the front, not the back, of the TV.  They are touchscreen too and blend in with the black border.- This TV has an extra composite video input in comparison to the 42LV4400.- Very thin and lightweight- Only cost me $529!Cons:- Doesn't have wi-fi access and apps, but I knew this going into the purchase.  These feature were not worth paying an extra $250 to me. If you want a Smart TV, then look at another model.A wonderful TV. Best video quality compared to everyone else's flat screen I've seen.  You will not regret this one.

Reviews.Title: Just What I Was Looking For
Reviews.Author: RAD "gadget guy"
Reviews.Content: I wanted an HDTV that could display from over the air, DVD player, and streamed Web video sources and also connect to my home surround sound system. I'm not sold on the "Internet-ready" TV concept (I don't want to be tied to applets, and I want complete configuration control over wireless connectivity to my home wireless network), so I looked for a TV that would allow me use a laptop's wireless capability to stream from the Web.This particular HDTV fit the bill. It provides a good OTA/DVD/Web picture, and it was easy to cable up HDMI from my Panasonic DVD player and HDMI from my Apple MacBook. I have an older MacBook that does not incorporate audio into its HDMI output, but this HDTV has an audio input port associated with its HDMI 1 port, so a separate audio cable from the laptop provided audio for streamed Web. I used an optical cable to connect the HDTV to my stereo system, so regardless of video input source, the TV provides audio out to my surround sound system.The picture quality is very good, and the connectivity possibilities of the TV fit my situation perfectly. I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Lots of bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: S. Hammond "suess"
Reviews.Content: We've had this tv for just a few days and are totally enthusiastic about it.Beautiful picture...especially on HD channels (takes some tweaking on the others).Everything about the transaction with Amazon was superb.  We did one day delivery and it came right on time. I was a little nervous about buying something so fragile via the internet, but the price was just too good to pass up so I took a chance and I'm' really glad I did.This is our second LG tv and I can't say enough good things about this brand.A really great tv.

Reviews.Title: Excellent set
Reviews.Author: J. Bayless
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV about a week ago and the TV is an excellent product and I highly recommend it.  I've been using it about (3) days and have had no problems.  Right out of the box it has an excellent, sharp and bright picture (with DirecTV HD receiver.)  The only problem with the whole experience is that the first TV that shipped to me came with no table-top stand and was missing the top half of the packaging material.  However, I called Amazon, explained what I had received and they promptly shipped to me - free upgraded shipping to next-day - another set.  That replacement TV was delivered to me the next day.  You can't ask for anything more.  Of course I had to lug the orignal TV to UPS as a return, which was a pain. But that's the cost of any internet, non-retail-storefront purchase.  Amazon customer support was very helpful.  Free return shipping too.  No complaints.  The only issue with the second set was that it was missing one of the eight screws that's used to attach the stand to the set.  But hey, I'll get by.  It's sturdy with seven screws.Ratings 1-5 :Picture - 5 (no edge bleeding on mine - perfect - sports on this TV is amazing, like looking through a window)Remote - 3.5 (no backlight)Owners manual - 2 (It's really bad - a multiple LG model owners manual that sucks to look stuff up with.  Sparce documentation.  Owners Manual also came on CD - haven't looked at that yet)Appearance - 5 (incredibly thin and light, beautiful polished black finish, very tasteful)Feature Menus - 4 (pretty standard, very intuitive and pretty user friendly)For a $500-$600 TV, you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: AMAZON came thru!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: AMAZON solved the problem.When my new T.V arrived I discovered it was broken.I was so sad and dissapointed with my purchase and felt like I was being given the run around until I contacted the Amazon live chatt customer service. The person that I told my story to not only was empathetic but offered a very good solution and my new T.V is on it's way ... Thank you Amazon for restoring my trust with you... It realy means everything when you get treated with dignity and repect,and the wrong gets righted.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, I love it!
Reviews.Author: Wilson R.
Reviews.Content: Part of the reason I bought this TV was that it was one of the few that would fit in my entertainment center.  I also made my decision based on the great reviews and excellent price for a LED TV.  I am very impressed with this TV whether it be for watching my standard definition satellite, off the air HD, or playing the XBOX.  The colors are very vivid and I like the matte finished screen that reduces glare since my TV is perpendicular to a window.  Great TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Berg
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV.  I'm no electronics expert, but the picture is great, the size was just what I was looking for, and it has a lot of handy connectors in the back for all of your video stuff and game toys.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Jaz
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before purchasing this TV.  I decided I wanted to have the LED over LCD, and the 37 inch screen LG brand.  I started out wanting a Samsung, but the price was too high.  LG was rated very high also.  I felt I was getting a lot of TV for the price.  I am thoroughly satisfied with the product w/one exception.  The auto adjuster for low light in the room always comes on inspite of the fact that I have it turned off.  That is very annoying at times as you cannot watch the TV in a dark room.  You must turn on a light so you get the proper brightness to see a good picture.  I would definitely recommend the LG to family and friends though, but I would let them know of this issue.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money
Reviews.Author: T. G. Howell
Reviews.Content: Over all I am very pleased with this TV. I primarily bought it because it was the largest flat screen tv I could fit in the cabinet in my den, and it had very good reviews on Amazon. This is the tv that I use the most in my household. Overall a great tv for the money, nothing fancy, but a very good picture and plenty of inputs. I have seen many complaints about the sound, but i think it is on par with other flat screens I have owned. Just fine for watching tv shows and sports. Obviously you will need a separate amp and speakers if you want home theater sound. As with all tv's, using a calibration disc to fine tune your video settings will optimize the picture you will see. I do agree with others that the automatic adjustment for ambient light conditions was annoying, so I disabled it.

Reviews.Title: Sound problem
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I have only had this TV for 2 weeks and the sound went out. We tried everything in the troubleshooting guide and it fixed it for a couple of hours.The picture is great and we received very quick delivery. It was very easy to setup. I was very happy with the TV until the sound went out.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV....
Reviews.Author: CurtP
Reviews.Content: Bought this on 12-01-11 and shipped on 12-04-11 received on 12-06-11 with standard FREE shipping.I needed a set that was the biggest I could find to fit my TV cabinet and this was one of the few thatfit it just right. This has just what most people need. I wanted 3 specific things in a TV..1)LED 2)Full HD 1080p 3)ENERGY STAR and this has them all. To pay extra for other silly stuff like 120HZor Smart Tv would be a waste for most people. Easy setup just screw the stand on and plug it in.The picture is outstanding. The LED really makes for the best picture quality. Bright and colorfuland all I have it on is the "standard" option. To me that's the best option. It does have a built inHD & digital tuner but it only gets a few HD and only a partial of my digital channels. I live inthe Chicago land area and have Comcast. So I had to plug in my digital box to recieve all of the digital channels.No HD but oh well. The sound is really just OK. BUT if you read Consumer Reports,all of the LED TV's from every brand, have just OK sound. If you think about it, these TV's are sothin, there is no way you can get any kind of quality sound in such a confined space. But I think it'sOK for the majority of people. If you want to watch movies and crank up the sound, I would sugest hooking aseperate sound source with additional speakers. So the lack of a compatable built in HD/digital receiver andsound quality I will deduct 1 star but I don't know if the camptibility issue is with comcast of themanufacturer and the sound, like I said is just as good as most other LED's. So all in all a really greatTV. The first time I've bought an LG and I hope that it lasts just as long as my 9 year old Sony and my19 year old RCA. And for your info I first bought this for $609 and then a week later it went to $449.With Amazons "TV Low Price Guarantee", I sent them an email and later on that day they sent me one backsaying they would refund me the $160 difference. So $449 and no tax, free shipping. Amazon is a no brainer. I don't knowwhy anyone would not buy from them. Hope this review helps and you will enjoy this TV...if you get it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Matt Guyver
Reviews.Content: LG makes the best entry model TV's on the market.  Has all of the expected inputs and picture is fantastic.  Super slim as well.

Reviews.Title: LG 37LV3500 37 inch TV
Reviews.Author: Anon
Reviews.Content: The TV has a nice picture and was very easy to set up.  I didn't realize until I went to hook up my Sony 6.1 surround receiver that the only digital audio output from the TV is via an Toslink optical cable!! My stereo receiver has optical video in but not optical audio.  Therefore the only way I can have surround sound with the TV is by running a coaxial cable from the satelite to the stereo receiver; then HDMI from the satelite to the TV. I get HDMI input to the TV from the satelite but no surround sound.  To get surround sound, I turn on the stereo receiver. At first I get sound from both the TV and the stereo receiver. I either have to turn down the TV volume or just turn the TV speaker off and get surround sound from the receiver only.  A coaxial audio output from the TV would have been nice but this solution works.

Reviews.Title: review of LG 42LV3500 42-inch
Reviews.Author: Joe Gap
Reviews.Content: The LED/LCD combination produces a clear bright picture! The sound is also clear and loud as you need!I am very satisfied!Joe Gap

Reviews.Title: HDMI outputs all went bad
Reviews.Author: Westbayou "Westbayou"
Reviews.Content: After owning this TV for 2 years, I felt like I should  review it following the issues I've had.  Picture is still great, but at a little over a year, I suddenly received a "No Signal" message and a blank screen.  I assumed either the DirecTV box or the HDMI cable had gone bad.  They had not, as when connected via component cables the picture was fine.  I recently hooked up a PS3, and I get the same message via HDMI, but not via the component.  After reading online, this is a very common problem with the LG tv's, and they will not warranty it after 12 months so you are left with 1 component hook up for HD and zero HDMI hookups.  Oh, and LG estimates the repair cost at $400.....er..... I paid $499 for the TV NEW.  Won't be buying an LG again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: varsha luthra
Reviews.Content: On time delivery and still working . The colors and sound quality is excellent and the TV is so slim and excellent price point.

Reviews.Title: backlighting bleeds through
Reviews.Author: Conner C. Mullally "mcmullett"
Reviews.Content: Backlighting bleeds through, wipes out lower left quadrant of screen when sceen is dark. Renders the screen effectively unwatchable when dark colors are on screen. To make matters worse, neither LG or the company providing the extra coverage I purchased are willing to fix the problem.

Reviews.Title: Picture is nice, but lost sound after warranty expired
Reviews.Author: Brent R. Blackburn "WYY551"
Reviews.Content: Picture is nice, but lost sound after warranty expired.  Had to buy a set of computer speakers now to actually hear tv.

Reviews.Title: LG is great.
Reviews.Author: David Burch
Reviews.Content: I'm an LG fan boy I guess.  I've had quite a few products that were LG already, from monitors to T.V.s and phones.  I've NEVER been disappointed.  This beauty is no exception!  Wonderful picture quality, contrast, and everything else great you can say about a flat screen.  Thin, light, beautiful.No cons.

Reviews.Title: My son loved it
Reviews.Author: Roxanne
Reviews.Content: Than  you for this my son loved it for Christmas. I was hoping for better shape but that's ok, the small flaws weren't that big. he was happy even with those.

Reviews.Title: Really nice TV
Reviews.Author: Shopping 4 My Girls "Tamara"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for our kids playroom a year ago.  It has been great. Picture is clear and it is great fun using with Dance Party on the Wii.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price I got it for back when....
Reviews.Author: Scott Cho "SwooP"
Reviews.Content: TV in use for over a year with no issues.  Black levels are huge concern for LG sets.  The set is extremely thin and have not seen too many which matched it at the time.  This TV is probably out of date now but it had a great remote and worked.  Recommended.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Becki Davis "kindle2lover"
Reviews.Content: Ordered this to go in an antique chest that I bought.  It fit nicely. Love it. It arrived in a timely manor

Reviews.Title: Great college/apartment tv!
Reviews.Author: phil.n.baker
Reviews.Content: I ordered this tv a little over a year ago and love it!  1080p looks absolutely flawless on a screen this size, and the picture wizard allows me to tinker with the setup whenever I want with ease.  The screen is bright enough to deflect a room surrounded in icicle lights (college apartment style) and three windows in the middle of the day.  The optical out connected easily to my Boston Acoustics sound bar, but the sound levels were already great on the tv alone.  When streaming movies through netflix on my ps3 the refresh rate was never a problem thanks to LG's tech. The only time I ever encountered a problem with blurry images was on low quality hd cable, but never enough to merit demoting this product to 4 stars.  This tv was the envy of the entire house I was living in, and it stands to reason!

Reviews.Title: Great value for money
Reviews.Author: Florin
Reviews.Content: The first item that I received had a broken corner (outer shell), although it was working properly.I returned that one and I received the next one quickly.Overall very good impression, picture quality is great, HD content looks very good.I was surprised to see it playing almost every file format including DivX, Xvid, and MKV via USB port (not MTS filmed with my camcorder, though).Subtitle support is also very good for the movies played via USB, and the subtitle size and font is configurable.

Reviews.Title: Reveiw of  LG 37LV3500 37-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LED-LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: truckinmann
Reviews.Content: I needed a new TV and searched quite awhile to find a good one that would fit in my existing entertainment center. There were quite a few out there, but after reading reviews I took my chances and went with the LG 37LV3500 37-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LED-LCD HDTV. When it arrived UPS had managed to break through the front of the packaging and literally break the screen. Amazon was quick to make it right, and shipped a replacement that day, and I got it a couple days later. The picture is magnificent! Bright, clear, everything you'd want in a picture. The sound is ok from the TV itself, but would be nicer with a surround sound system hooked up. The remote is easy to understand and make adjustments with. Navigation between different components hooked up to it is by 1 button. Couldn't be simpler. I have a VCR, a PS3, a DVD player-recorder, cable TV, and a laptop hooked up to it, and all look great! The 37 inch size is perfect for the size room I have, and fits my entertainment system perfectly. I wouldn't hesitate to purchase another one if I needed another TV.

Reviews.Title: 21st Century Television.
Reviews.Author: Rosalind R. Williams "rozzycakes"
Reviews.Content: This television has exceeded my expectations. First, it was easy to set up.  I did not need an extra pair of hands to remove it from the box, or put it together.  Then the instruction booklet is easy to read; you don't have to go through fifty pages of specs to get to the how-to.  The color was pretty good right out of the box, but being a photographer I had to color-correct to my specifications, and it was easy as pie.LG 37LV3500 37-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LED-LCD HDTV

Reviews.Title: Good picture. Easy to install.
Reviews.Author: T. Schaefer
Reviews.Content: This televsion has peformed exactly as expected with easy setup and a good quality picture. We haven't experienced any difficulties with it.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: Abel
Reviews.Content: TV looks great, good picture and decent sound from built in speakers. Connected auxiliary speakers and sub woofer via headphone jack but can not use audio controls when outputting to headphone jack.  Will need to use the Digital Audio Out (Optical).

Reviews.Title: high quality
Reviews.Author: thunderq
Reviews.Content: if you don't need wifi with tv, this tv is a good choice: high resolution and perfect sound effect. 3 HDMI and 1 USB let you connect to whatever you want.

Reviews.Title: LG LV3500
Reviews.Author: sparks
Reviews.Content: Awesome picture, menus are super-intuative and easy to use.  Was a little concerned about the 60 hz scan rate, but there is no discernable motion smear.  This was only one of three 37" sets that would fit my entertainment center, plus all the buttons are on the front of the set.

Reviews.Title: A worthy replacement for my Samsung Plasma
Reviews.Author: Gil
Reviews.Content: My Samsung plasma died 2 months past it's warranty period.  I was a firm believer in the superior quality of a plasma screen, but this LG is definitely in the same league. The first time I saw an HD broadcast of a Planet Earth documentary, I was blown away.  Also, my daughter loves watching CGI movies like Shrek, Monsters inc, etc. and the image really pops on this screen.  Here's my short bullet list of pros and cons.Pros- Wonderful image quality.  Images really pop.- No issue with motion blur, unless your cable provider is at fault.- Ridiculously energy efficient. I think it was like $13 a year assuming 5 hours per day.- Built in menu driven TV image calibration.  This really helped to get the best image quality.- Super thin- Anti glare really works.  I have a fish tank near my couch and it no longer casts a reflection while watching TV.  When the TV is off, you can see a bit of reflection.Cons- Viewing angle not as wide as Plasma.- Sound from speakers are a bit weak.  Lacks bass.Overall, I am extremely happy with this purchase and doubt that I'll be going back to plasma.

Reviews.Title: 37" LG LED/LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Joan Quinn
Reviews.Content: I love this TV!  The size is just right and the picture quality is beautiful.  I can't find any negatives so far and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Bang for the buck!
Reviews.Author: Joel
Reviews.Content: For this price paid this as a great product. I love the styling of it and how thin it is. The menus are also easy and intuitive. Nicely done LG! My only complaint is the brightness. I know this is an LCD TV so it's supposed to be bright but the blacks tend to look more like greys. I may just need to play around with some more setting though. Overall, the picture quality is great.

Reviews.Title: good tv for the price
Reviews.Author: dadof3
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 other tv's before getting to this one. Bought Vizio and the picture was just not good. Bought newwer version of this one at Best Buy and found it cheaper on Amazon. Returned it and bought this on Amazon. This is a very good TV with great picture. Easy to set up. sports are good with no visible effects of this tv only being 60 Hz. 2nd best TV in my house. Samsung in living room cant be beat on picture. I would buy this TV again if needed another TV.

Reviews.Title: I didn't know what I was missing.
Reviews.Author: Lois Lyle "Christian One"
Reviews.Content: We purchased a flat screen HD television about four years ago and it pales combared to the new LG. I had no idea TV could be so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Alex Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: I'd been lusting for an HDTV for many years now, in past 3 weeks my financial stubbornness broke and I picked up one of these (LG V3500 42").  I am very happy with my television, it mounted to my wall beautifully and played nice with all of my devices.The Good:- good variety of inputs- very thin and aesthetically pleasing bezel- panel itself is very thin- great picture quality (turn off auto-adjust/ light sensor)- easy to set up and adjust- USB input for playing videos works well (make sure your drive is FAT32, it won't read Mac OS X Journaled)The Bad:- first tv arrived with a patch of stuck pixels (Amazon customer service was excellent)- both tv's have a brighter patch in the bottom right-hand side (generally unnoticeable)- only audio out is optical or headphones, no RCADefinitely recommend this TV for anyone looking for an affordable, no frills (no 3d, no internet, not a 'smart' tv) LED.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product. Excellent Service
Reviews.Author: Cecilia Case
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with this television. It looks good, was a very reasonable price, and we had our usual excellent Amazon experience. In particular, we had a chance to test the various processes, because we received a defective TV. It has a dim spot in the lower left corner of the screen, almost like the backlight wasn't lit in that area. We were very concerned, and called Amazon. They said they would be happy to receive the television back at no cost, but they had no more in stock to exchange for us.We decided not to return it, and instead try the LG In-Home Warranty Service. Weirdly enough, Amazon still initiated a return process, but we didn't need to do anything other then send the UPS guy away when he came to our house. LG was very prompt with communication, and sent out a technician that actually replaced a part in the television! He was competent, prompt, and very little hassle at all. He fixed the problem, and now we don't have to send the TV back. We are very satisfied with the product, with Amazon's communication, and with LG's warranty service.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!!!
Reviews.Author: Diana Chipkin
Reviews.Content: I gave this TV to my sister for Christmas and this is what she said:"This is my first flat screen so I have nothing to compare it to but as far as I'm concerned this is a great TV! I think the sound is best in the Music mode.Also, this TV was quick and easy to install and LG's customer support is there when you need them...in fact, they were fantastic! (I called them for an issue that ended up being a bad wire and not really relating to the set-up).LG=LIFE IS GOOD!!!"

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV - Well worth the price
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: Outstanding TV.  I was stuck between 3: the LG 42LK450 42-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LCD HDTV, LG 42LK520 42-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LCD HDTV, and this LED LG 42LV3500 42-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LED-LCD HDTV.  At the time, the 42 inch LCD 60hz was priced at $530, the 42 inch LCD 120hz was priced at $580 and this 42 inch LED 60hz was $590.  I was debating the 60hz vs 120hz and I learned that 120hz can lag video games gameplay (if you dont turn off the 120hz) which is why I chose to go with the 60hz.  I decided to spend the extra $60 for the LED version because of the lightness in weight, brightness in color / overall color quality.Everything is 5 stars except for of course the sound quality which I give it a good 4 out of 5 stars.  Like all flat screen, its hard find great speakers.  This product does come with a headphone jack that you can plug in speakers.  Originally it only had a Mono option but with my speakers plugged in, I noticed it switched to a Stereo setting.  Just get a decent speakers with a sub woofer and you should be all set for movies and gamesBut yes I am very happy with the Picture Wizard color settings program.  You can tweak the image as bright and vibrant as you want or as realistic as you want.  Very awesome TV for its price.Oh yes and Amazon does do the price guarantee so i was able to get some money back after the price went down to as low as $529.

Reviews.Title: Super slim, nice picture
Reviews.Author: JKN
Reviews.Content: We ordered this TV due to the compact size. It's a 37 inch screen that's under 35 inches wide. It was the only TV would could find this compact with the 37 inch screen. Nice picture, especially when viewing a digital HD program. The on-board sound is not that great, but not an issue of you have a sound system to connect to it. Lots of easy-to-use custom settings.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!!!!!
Reviews.Author: CAM
Reviews.Content: This is my first flat screen so I have nothing to compare it to but as far as I'm concerned this is a great TV!  I think the sound is best in the Music mode.Also, this TV was quick and easy to install and LG's customer support is there when you need them...in fact, they were fantastic!  (I called them for an issue that ended up being a bad wire and not relating to LG or the set-up).LG=LIFE IS GOOD!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: HarryZ
Reviews.Content: LG 37LV3500 has great picture and works as expected although had to connect it to the DVR with HDMI cable to eliminate annoying and intermittent hum from TV when it was connected via DVRs Component cables.  I  do know that the HDMI cable is a better cable than Component connection cables.  Wish my entertainment center would allow a larger than 37" TV.

Reviews.Title: led tv
Reviews.Author: jerry aimette
Reviews.Content: THE LG 37 LV3500 TV IS AN EXCEPTIONAL VALUE FOR THE MONEY AND ESPECIALLY THROUGH AMAZON WHERE MY PURCHASE PRICE OF $449 WAS HUNDREDS BELOW COMPETING OFFERS. PICTURE & SOUND ALONG WITH 1080P & LED CAN'T BE BEAT.  A FINE PRODUCT WITH ALL THE FEATURES.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: jw
Reviews.Content: This is a great product!  Picture is excellent, and though I was concerned about it being only 60 hertz, there is no blurring that I can discern.  Sound is fine for tv speakers.  Great buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: Love My LG
Reviews.Author: DCH101
Reviews.Content: I love my LG!  It is all I wanted it to be.  The colors and contrast are sharp.  I am a believer in shopping at Amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Geek
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent and affordable TV. It is tough to find 37" TV that fits our entertainment center. The picture is nice.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV!
Reviews.Author: Richard Schneider
Reviews.Content: I needed this size to fit in my old (but nice) enetertainment center. I'm VERY glad I went with the LED (and not LCD). Picture and available settings are amazing. Like all flat screens, the sound from the TV speakers is terrible. Hooking up to a home theater is a MUST.

Reviews.Title: A great TV
Reviews.Author: Linkers
Reviews.Content: Purchased through amazon, this TV arrived quickly and in working order.  The TV looks sleek and the picture quality is fantastic.  Equally as impressed with the audio.  I couldn't believe the difference in picture compared to my 720p TV that it replaced.  Works wonderfully with the xbox360.  I even benefited from amazon's low TV price guarantee and was credited a rebate for the drop in price.  Very very satisfied with the LG3500 TV and purchasing it through amazon.comone minor con: TV does not automatically detect a signal and switch over to the device.Would definitely buy again.

Reviews.Title: Slim, Beautiful Color!!!
Reviews.Author: wanasu
Reviews.Content: Beautiful HD LED TV! Wonderful Colors and Beautiful Designs. Very slim and light.So eager to use and watch. I like LG.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: jlawton
Reviews.Content: My 32" sony crt bit the dust, Have a set up that would only accomidate up to a 37" tv.Did a lot of research almost settled on a 32" but found this set. I couldn't find this set in any store,but did see other LG's of bigger size in the same lv class.I have been impressed with Samsung picture quality, and almost settled on a 32" Samsung,but gambled and ordered the LG. I recieved it in 3 days,and I am very impressed with the picture quality,right there with the Samsung. Like some of the other reviewers was a little worried about the 60 hz refresh rate,but after watching football and hockey,thereis no problem.A few setup tips, the tv comes with certain picture setups, like vivid , standard ,cinama etc. The standard setup was pretty good but I found that setting backlight at 89, contrast at 90 brightness at 50and color at 61 came out with the best picture all around for me. I found the vivid setting was over saturated.Also turn on clearvoice under audio and you will find that the sound quality is pretty good.Also recommend turning off eco mode,auto screen dimming,picture became to dark with it on.Overall very impressed with set, I wouldnt worry about spending more for 120 or 240 refresh rate, and this set still has componet and composite connections that are vanishing from alot of the newer sets.Has good picture on standard coaxial feed, but shines on HD input.

Reviews.Title: Best Bang for the Buck
Reviews.Author: BrianT
Reviews.Content: Feel like I stole this TV.  Somehow I got lucky and happened to be looking for TV's when Amazon had it for $449. I needed a TV for a specific place in the house and the largest I could go was 37 inches.  Only I found that not many people make 37 inch televisions anymore.  TV sets up easy, picture is great with a few adjustments to your liking, but honestly didn't do too much.  I was worried about the sound as most flat screens really have terrible sound, but this one isn't bad.  Better than expected, but if you are going to use it for "home theater" you are going to run it through a receiver anyway.  Very easy menus compared to other TV's I have owned.  Currently running Blueray player and Roku through it via HDMI and it works very well.  Only downfall is it isn't internet ready, but for $450 you can't beat it.  Also want to give a compliment to Amazon, recently joined Amazon Prime and bought this TV.  Just for kicks I added the $3.99 for next day shipping and sure enough had the TV on my doorstep one day after purchase.  Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: LG 37LV3500 great picture, sized right
Reviews.Author: Skipmuckid "Ret ElecTech"
Reviews.Content: At 35" wide, this TV was just the size I needed to replace an older analog TV with a newerLED HD TV that would fit in my built-in oak entertainment cabinet's TV opening. The added bonus is an excellent HD TV with a great consumer rating because of its perfect HDpicture right out of the box. The cons greatly outweigh the negatives, and actually I can'tthink of anything bad to report on the TV itself so far except for one thing... The Owners Manual provided is a real mess. LG has seen fit to included at least two dozendifferent TV models in one manual making easy reading and individual setup a real nightmare.The only manual worse then this one is when they merge several different languages on the samepage of your instruction manual. So if you are tech savy enough to live with a crappy manualthis HD LED LCD TV is an excellent value and has everything else going for it. TV A+, User Manual C-

Reviews.Title: Can't beat the price
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Great TV all around. If you are looking for this size...buy it now. Under $500 you can't possibly go wrong!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: chillnc
Reviews.Content: There's nothing bad I can say about this TV. I bought it so I could cancel my cable and get an Apple TV box to stream netflix and itunes. (My old TV didn't have an HMDI port, so I couldn't plug in an Apple TV.) This TV is great; the picture is incredibly sharp and the screen is extremely non-reflective so it looks beautiful and rich even during the day when there is normally tons of screen glare. If I had to nitpick, I guess I would say the sound is the weakest part of the TV -- but it's still good enough that I haven't felt the need add on speakers. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Led is Outstanding
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Matthews
Reviews.Content: I love All of LG TV, the color with Led. The color and picture outstanding! Andease of use,set up is very fast.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: This TV is lightweight, thin, easy to pick up and move around.  The picture quality is superb: ultra clear, vivid colors and almost three dimensional. If the price were lower, I would buy a second one.

Reviews.Title: Great flat screen, great price
Reviews.Author: Thomas W. DeMello
Reviews.Content: Got the best price out there from Amazon on this TV and it is a great value.  Prompt delivery, easy set up out of the box, excellent picture, decent sound.  I had a relatively small area to put this TV into and I was happy that the compact design of this unit allowed me to get the 37" in there. My room can be bright but the LED technology and non-glare screen mean I get a good picture on all but the sunniest days.  Downside of 37" and smaller LG's is that there is no SmartTV feature, but I also bought Apple TV and I am watching all my content from my laptop on the LG as well.  Old episodes of "the Wire" from iTunes look fabulous and couldn't be easier.  Great job LG and thanks Amazon for the great price and faster than expected free delivery.

Reviews.Title: A Great Large Screen HD TV
Reviews.Author: J. Scotchler
Reviews.Content: I purchased this 42 inch LG  TV thru Amazon.  I received the package exactly when promised in good condition.  I am very happy with the TV.  Great picture from any angle and easy to use.  I really like the larger picture and higher definition.I get the feeling that it is almost real.  A great addition to our viewing pleasure.'

Reviews.Title: 37" LG  flat screen LED-LCD HD TV
Reviews.Author: carolyn lanese
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are really enjoying our 37" LG flat screen.  The picture is clear and the colors are very good.  I'd buy an LG again, in fact I have an LG cell phone. The instruction booklet could be better, especially when dealing with the picture color and resolution. Most people in our age bracket need more details in the instructions and more trouble shooting questions and answers. Also wish the instruction booklets could be separate for languages - big book - half of which is unusable for Americans. Needed to call our cable company for some help too - not LG's problem though - don't forget to call to go from analog to HD before working on the TV if analog is what you have..C. Lanese

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a very reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Robert Stoll
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to add to other reviews other than to say I'm extremely pleased with the picture quality.  For this price it's a fantastic purchase for a bedroom or small office.

Reviews.Title: LG LCD/LED 37LV3500 TV
Reviews.Author: Thomas A. Nowling "Scyther4077"
Reviews.Content: I must state that this tv, LG 37LV3500 37-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LED HDTV, is one of the best I have seen in a long time for the price range that it was in.  I used to work in a major department store for 7 years so, I have sold a lot of lcd/led tvs when they came out and this was one that I really wanted to get my hands on but, at the time, the price was, well, out of my price range.  It is not surprising that the quality is so good considering that LG used to be known as Goldstar until 1995.  It also shows that it picked the right company to take over which was Zenith, which was a superb, well-known household name at the time.
