Who knew that a company that was founded in 1958 that produced such household appliances such as washing machines and air conditioners would be the second-largest manufacturer of tvs.  I couldn't believe on how fast the shipping was.  It took a total of three days to get here.  I wasn't expecting it for at least a week!  The simplicity of the controls and setup made it quick for me to start gaming in virtually no time.  All in all this television was surely worth every cent that I paid for it and the quality just speaks for itself.  Keep up the good work Amazon with choosing the best brands to back on your wonderful site.  Thank you and cheers!

Reviews.Title: Great LED TV
Reviews.Author: Terry M.
Reviews.Content: This LG TV is excellent, sound and picture. So far its the best TV I have owned. I recommend this kind of TV (LED) to everyone who is a bug on an excellent picture. For the money its worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: GOOD BUY
Reviews.Author: silvia
Reviews.Content: NICE PICTURE EASY TO ASSEMBLENEEDED NEW TV IN DEN BOUGHT THE SAME ONE IN 37 INCH BUT SEEMED  SMALL SO I RETURNED IT AND GOT 42 INCH SAME MODEL AS I REALLY LIKED ITONLY DRAW BACK SOUND HAS A CLICKY SOUND WHEN CHANGING CHANELS BUT NOT A BIG DEAL

Reviews.Title: excellent for the price
Reviews.Author: nancy
Reviews.Content: It was a bit scary buying a tv online having never seen the model here first.  But I did my homework.  Checked out the options available to flat panels, and decided what I wanted before I actually bought the tv.  That helped a lot.  It was also very helpful to read reviews about this specific tv before buying.  So when we turned it on and it had the annoying problem of getting darker as the room light got darker, I knew how to adjust it.

Reviews.Title: Best HDTV ever
Reviews.Author: Andrew J. Doukas
Reviews.Content: This is the best HDTV I have experienced. Picture is better than my Samsung LCD and my Samsung LED.  I like how the screen darkens or brightens automatically to match the ambient room light. The menus are intuitive and it is so easy to setup or switch to a DVD or other peripheral input. I am hoping to buy another for the bedroom!

Reviews.Title: Great picture.
Reviews.Author: J. Stewart "honest buyer"
Reviews.Content: This television has a great picture quality. The sound isn't the best, but adequate. The design is very sleek. We are quite happy.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: toaster
Reviews.Content: Package arrived in good order. Setup was easy. Picture quality is good. Sound quality is good.The only issue I am currently having is with a media pc hooked up via the hdmi-3 input that shows odd scan lines for some darker screen backgrounds. These scan lines only appear when the dark background fills most of the screen. This does not happen on my dvd hdmi output (plugged into hdmi-1 input), so I am fairly certain it has something to do with one of: the graphics card or driver in media pc, some setting I haven't yet identified in XBMC (media player running on the media pc) related to hdmi output.Other than the likely unrelated (to this television) annoyance noted above, this unit has so far exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Really more than I expected
Reviews.Author: Alexander Ortiz
Reviews.Content: I really expected a normal LED TV, without lot of thing than it has. It's a very good TV, I bought with a wall mount and fitted excellent in my room, the lead time was sooooo good!It's very slim and the picture is so clear and beatiful.I'm going to buy another one for my daugther's room. What amazon will do for me in orther to get the second one for my daugther?.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with our new TV
Reviews.Author: j.k. "amazon shopper"
Reviews.Content: Although this one only has a 60HZ screen refresh rate, it delivers beautiful clear pictures. I went to Best BUY before ordering this one from Amazon, comparing the clarity differences between LG 60HZ LED and LG 120HZ LED, I found them to be very similar. Great price for a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased with unit
Reviews.Author: Clay F. Mitchell
Reviews.Content: Read many reviews about LG units with non-ISP panels.  This unit was shipped from a camera store in NY, purchased on a Mon. morning, out for delivery by UPS on Wednesday, (they put it on the wrong truck), got it Thursday.  Picture quality and sound are excellent. The S/N on my unit is 3500UA-SUSDJK, went to hhgregg and the one there is 3500UA-CUSDLH.  Both units looked the same from front or side angles. There is a slight cloud view when at the 176 degree angle, but I also saw that in the store on many other sets that cost $1500 - $2500. The unit has been in our home for 2 weeks and we've been pleasantly pleased with all the features.  This unit at hhgregg and Crutchfield is $161 more than Amazon.  Even if I ordered it from the store in NY, they charged more.  Kudos to Amazon on this one.

Reviews.Title: Lg stands for Legendary Graphics
Reviews.Author: dnas420
Reviews.Content: bought this for the see in cart price for my bedroom and boy what a deal! the tv came within the time provided ( not fast enough for me =) ) Ups dropped it off, i set it up within 5 minutes from stand to cables in and programed. the colors are great! screen is super flat! and the tv is super easy to setup! if you want to save over 200 buy it now and dont think about it again. specs are very good compared to most other led lcds in its catagory. highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a nice tv to show off the game on.

Reviews.Title: Good but...
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: This is our first flat screen TV (we got the 42"), so I can't say if it is better or worse than other LED TVs.  All I can compare it to is our old 25" low-cost big-back TV.We've had the LG TV for almost a week now, and we've used it to play video games, watch live soccer, watch cable, stream Netflix through an Xbox, and play DVD's on an Xbox.  We're pretty happy with it over all except when watching cable.  When we're using it to play video games or to watch DVD's and streaming Netflix, it's good, but cable shows look awful.  We called the cable company and they suggested that we need an HD cable box to fix the problem.  Unfortunately, we didn't know we'd need an HD cable box to get a decent picture on the TV, and since we are not prepared for the extra monthly expense right now, we are stuck with a lot of ghosting while watching cable.  The sound isn't as good as our old TV either, but we can live with that.  I am not completely happy with the color and brightness even though I have gone through and changed all the settings a dozen times and have used the Picture Wizard, but it's not bad.  I also don't like having to stretch the shows to fit the aspect ratio since it distorts the picture, but what's the point of the bigger screen if the picture doesn't fill it?  The zoom option works better, but it's still not ideal, and I am tired of changing the settings every time we want to watch something different.  Honestly, I would like to send the TV back and go back to our old big-back TV, but the big screen is great for Xbox and movies, so we will keep it and eventually get the HD cable box.

Reviews.Title: Very good TV at the very affordable price
Reviews.Author: Michael Z. Sosis "Alien Epee"
Reviews.Content: I like this TV very much. It is very thin and the picture is very good as well. The only shortcoming is it's limited and hard to find set up menu. Otherwise, I am gladly recommending this TV.

Reviews.Title: Good tv
Reviews.Author: Al S.
Reviews.Content: Have used this tv only a day, but picture is good right out of the box.  Sound is good too.  So far only watching standard def while waiting to get upgraded sat box.  But for old shows not in HD, they look good.  There aren't a lot of 37 inch tvs out there, so if that's the size you need, you should consider this one.Can't rate it 5 stars until I see the HD at work.Also not a real long power cord.  Never a consideration before, but I mounted this one on a wall, and it barely plugs in.

Reviews.Title: I am sure this would have been a stellar product and glad I ordered from Amazon
Reviews.Author: Mary Jfitzpatrick "CrazyMary"
Reviews.Content: TV turned out to be HUGE. Glad Amazon delivered to my door because as a senior citizen with weight and range of motion issues I never could have gotten out of the trunk of my car and to my fourth floor apartment. Can't tell you really anything about this TV (but was highly recommended by my geek son) because a major part of the base was missing. Here is the good news: Amazon could not get me a replacement part but they immediatley sent UPS to my door with a prepaid pickup shipping sticker and I got a credit back on my charge card within the next two days. Now THAT is customer service.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with purchase
Reviews.Author: jmgould76
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to replace our slowly dying 2004 Samsung 21" tv - which has served me faithfully for many years.  I did a LOT of research, talked to several salespeople at hhgregg, and got input from my brother and father (both HUGE tech junkies) - and I finally choose this LG.  It had everything I wanted LED/LCD, HD, and a nice clean look (and simple picture adjustments). My only complaint is that no matter what I do, I can not get the menu screen for my satellite provider to be clear (everything on the Wii is fine, DVD player, and any actual stations are crisp and clear - so it may be an issue with the actual satellite provider.

Reviews.Title: LG TV
Reviews.Author: Amma
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased with our purchase, good picture quality, easy to set up and use. The automatic light contrast was an unusual effect we were not used to at first, now that we are used to it we like it very much. We would recommend this TV at a little higher cost but worth the money not a throw away TV

Reviews.Title: LG 37 inch 1089p LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: rrabe
Reviews.Content: Love this TV.  We haven't used it a lot because it is for our camper, but it is clear and sounds really good.  We were impressed.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Picture, OK Sound
Reviews.Author: Computer Geek "Computer Geek"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to mount in a motorhome.  I mated it with an LG Home Theater system and the two work so well together it's almost magic.  The iPod dock works better than any dock I've used, and sounds better too.  The TV sound by itself is OK but not as good as one with larger speakers would be.  I tweaked the audio to reduce the treble and increase the bass and that helped but you still have to turn it way up to get adequate volume.I suspect that wimpy sound is just to be expected with LED TV's because they're so thin.  But in my case thin was exactly what I was looking for.The picture: in a word, it's awesome.  Crystal clear, no edge brightness or fall-off, no dead pixels.  Even watching SD DVD's on this TV is better than most.

Reviews.Title: Uneven brightness across the screen
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: I purchased this LG LED TV with much anticipation. Upon arrival, everything about it was seemingly great, except... I noticed that the right edge of the screen (about 20%) was a bit darker than the rest when looking at a white screen. This was not a back-light issue, but it had to do with a defect in the angular viewing properties when looking at the screen. As with all LCD screens there is a drop off while viewing at an angle. However this one was apparent while looking straight at it (on the right side). It was unacceptable and I returned it. (Amazon was fantastic with the return - no problem at all)So, I'm not sure if this was a one-off defect or if it is inherent in many of them. This is something that many folks may not have noticed with normal TV viewing, but I am picky about this sort of thing.I will be looking for another brand due to fear that this is inherent in their manufacturing process.

Reviews.Title: solid tv
Reviews.Author: R. Martinez
Reviews.Content: The LG was easy to set up, picture was great, sound was very good, thus far no complaints.  Oh yes, and I received the order several days sooner than expected.

Reviews.Title: LG 37 inch LED TV
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture and was very easy to set up.  This is a great TV especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: My Sanyo 37" 720p 2008 LCD has a superior picture but this one is ok
Reviews.Author: T. Swanson "MtBcondoDOTcom"
Reviews.Content: I have a Sanyo LCD 720p HDTV from 2008 that I feel has a better picture than this LED 1080p LG.  The LED makes everything shiny, like diamonds, and it seems to distract from the picture.  Also, I cannot read the text at the bottom of the picture with the LG, like the news station channel and temperature etc.  But this LG is superior with it's menu functions and labeling of inputs etc.  As mentioned in other reviews, I do find it an inconvenience to not have the option to keep the tv speakers on when the headphone out jack is used to feed sound back to an "old school" receiver.  I've been putting off placing a bad or mediocre review for this since I want to love it, but it's just not as perfect as all these positive reviews may make it out to be.  I will definitely keep it for the price I paid.For the $450 sale price this LG TV is more like 4 stars, but it loses a star for any price higher.Update on 4/27/2012I have really grown to love this tv.  The fact that it turns on so quickly and has no annoyances compared to many other tv's I've had has made it a great buy and I've upgraded my review to 4 solid stars.

Reviews.Title: Great experience with LG HDTV
Reviews.Author: Cy Yentz "Fang-follower"
Reviews.Content: The LG 37LV3500 has proven to be an extremely satisfying television.  Though it has no output connections for external devices or speakers, I assume that to be common in the newer technology.  The increase in clarity over standard TV is exceptional and the HD programming has added a new dimension to my appreciation of television programs and movies, both received through dish and viewed from DVD.

Reviews.Title: Not as crisp as i thought it would be.... adendum
Reviews.Author: M. E. Wolfe "let's be kind"
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's me, but i can't seem to get the images to sharpen up. Even with the HDMI cable, the digital doesn't look any better. in fact, it's ultra pixilated, so I prefer the blurry edges of the coaxial cable. I've been toying with the idea of sending it back, but I so dread the hassle, I'm almost willing to deal with it. Since it's my first modern TV since the huge tube of the past, I don't know if it's me or not.Addendum to my first post....Yes, I am learning more now and I should have had HD through Comcast or an antenna. I feel bad about sending back the first TV. It was probably fine. I have the same issue with this one. It would have been nice if Comcast had educated me before I did this, but maybe I should have asked. For those of you as technologically dim as I, be sure you have HD, not just a digital signal. I bet this TV rocks when I get the HD!

Reviews.Title: ok, not the best
Reviews.Author: mark123123
Reviews.Content: Shipping was outstanding, but showed up with a pixel problem, not a big deal considering it was shipped from the US to Iraq.I like my Vizio back home a lot more, though the LG has better sound, the Vizio has a better picture and comes with a lit remote.ratings based on 1-5, 1 very poor - 5 outstandingPICTURE:  3SOUND:  4FEATURES:  2QUALITY:  2PRICE:  5If price isn't an issue, go with a Samsung, Sony, or Sharp..........Philips and Visio, in my opinion, are great cheap alternatives in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: HDTV 37" 1080p LED 60Hz - LG 37LV3500
Reviews.Author: Grandma D
Reviews.Content: LG 37LV3500 37-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LED HDTVShopped extensively for a 37" LED 1080p HDTV.  This one had the best reviews and at the time of my purchase, 5/25/11, I found the best price of of $499.99 with free shipping to be through Amazon. Pros: Exterior: Clean lines, exactly as shown. Picture quality as expected. Cons: (1)Was looking forward to the auto-dim but it seems to work in reverse of what I expected. Thought the picture would brighten up when the room was darker and alternately become darker & more contrasting when the room light was brighter.  Instead, the picture becomes very dark, the darker the room. So, now instead of watching TV as we used to with just the lowest of a 3-way bulb on, we have to make the room brighter so the picture is brighter.  Haven't messed with trying to see if we can turn the dim feature off, so don't know if it would make the TV's light & dark any better. But, in short the promoted feature does not work as we expected. (2)Reflection off the screen is greater than my old regular TV. (3)There is no separate Audio connection for other speakers. So, in order to use our other Stereo system speakers, we had to connect them in a way that allows only their use and turns off the TV speakers entirely. With our old antiquated TV, we could either listen to non-musical programming via the TV speakers or use the stereo with greater bass, etc., for music. Now there is no sound at all from the TV unless we manually first turn the stereo on.Added notes: (1) I called LG directly to see why their 120Hz 37" model was being discountinued. For what it's worth.. They said something like not all other devices can be connected with the 120Hz.  I truly was not clear with their explanation.(2) FYI.. Our TV provider is AT&T; U-Verse so with very little exception, after all is set up, that is the remote that is used.

Reviews.Title: LG 37LV3500 37-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LED-LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: WebER
Reviews.Content: I am very concerned over my recent order from Amazon.  I read a prior April 2012 review about the irregular illumination of the screen, and was surprised that I had the same defect.  When I inspected the unit I found that it appeared damaged and must question whether or not they sent me the TV that had been returned. See the images that I have posted.

Reviews.Author: MGLady
Reviews.Content: Recently I noticed a specific reference to Matte screens on some LG models . .and now no mention of that feature . .Is it gone as a choice???And am I the only person who noticed the prices went up for the Basketball tournament?

Reviews.Title: Great 37" TV
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: The TV is great and I only have two complaints.1. It is 60Hz not 120, but at this size it seams quite hard to find 120Hz.2. No WIFI built in.I have it connected to my Blu-Ray player which has WIFI.

Reviews.Title: Not LED quality
Reviews.Author: ID
Reviews.Content: I based this purchase on all the great reviews i read about this TV. I was not satisfied with the picture or sound and now i am in the process of returning it. It is NOT LED quality, the picture is not as clear as you would expect it to be. I can definitely find a better TV for this price.

Reviews.Title: Beware of Fragility
Reviews.Author: C. Hernandez
Reviews.Content: We finally purchased our first flat screen last July when we realized our old tube TV was NEVER going to die. It was 15 years old and still going strong, but we wanted the slimmer design, and the LG had the best reviews on Amazon. Now, only 9 months after our purchase, the TV will have to go to the dump due to a piece of a hairbrush coming loose from its handle and hitting the screen, cracking it. The impact wasn't immense, but obviously these screens are extremely delicate. I am deeply disappointed in the quality of the design that such a mild accident could render a brand-new $600 TV destroyed. The two ceramic vases I have on either side of this TV are apparently much more robust. Although the TV is less than a year old and still under warranty, this type of damage is not covered.  After writing LG customer service, I got a response telling me there's nothing they can do for me, and then they had the gall to end their response with "Thank you for choosing LG, and have a wonderful day!"

Reviews.Title: Not for the hearing impaired.  Forget about LG
Reviews.Author: Charles E. Carlson "Sengekontacket"
Reviews.Content: It was difficult to adjust the TV for a good picture.  After a struggle, I am pleased with the picture.  I used the LG hotline and they were helpful.  I have one issue that others LG purchasers might have also.  One of our viewers us hearing disabled and likes to use headphones.  There are two audio outputs - a headphone jack and an optical audio output.  When you use any of the audio outputs, the TV speakers are shut down.  For those people who are hearing impaired and want to use an auxiliary audio system in conjunction with the TV speakers, forget about LG.  From what I understand, this is a software issue with all LG TV's. I would have never purchased an LG TV if I had known that the manufacturer did not support the hearing disabled. Put LG on the NO NO list.
